Decaf Editor API

Uses of Interface
org.hs.jfc.HotComponent

Packages that use HotComponent
com.bitwise.decaf.editor This package contains the foundation of the Decaf editor, including all user interface components for code constructs up to but excluding the contents of method bodies (those are found in the grammar package). 
com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar This package contains the user interface foundation for the contents of method bodies. 
org.hs.jfc This package contains alternatives to some of the cumbersome facilities of the JFC. 
 

Uses of HotComponent in com.bitwise.decaf.editor
 

Subinterfaces of HotComponent in com.bitwise.decaf.editor
 interface DecafTextComponent
          A further specification of MaskComponent for declaration fields that must provide the user with a plain text input mechanism.
 interface DecafTypeComponent
          A further specification of MaskComponent for declaration fields that must provide the user with a Type-compatible input mechanism.
 interface MaskComponent
          A MaskComponent is designed for use in one of the declaration masks: ClassMask, MethodMask and VariableMask.
 

Classes in com.bitwise.decaf.editor that implement HotComponent
 class com.bitwise.decaf.editor.DListBox
           
 class DTextField
          A generic text field that implements the requisite interfaces for participation in the Decaf masks.
 class DTypeBox
          A generic type box (consisting of a {@link javax.swing.JPanel)) that implements the requisite interfaces for participation in the Decaf masks.
 class Mask
          A specialization of Form that extracts a list of components from a configuration file entry and places them into the superclass.
 

Uses of HotComponent in com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar
 

Classes in com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar that implement HotComponent
 class ParagraphBox
          The standard editor component for a Paragraph.
 

Uses of HotComponent in org.hs.jfc
 

Methods in org.hs.jfc with parameters of type HotComponent
 void HotStation.register(HotComponent component)
          Register component with the HotStation.
 void HotStation.unregister(HotComponent component)
          Remove component from the HotStation; it will no longer respond to station activity.
